tags.description:
The Device Group Tree resource allows you to create folders and static device groups.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Getting started with device groups
  • Working with device groups and folders
  • Creating static device groups
  • Creating folders

Smart device groups are not currently supported in the Device Group Tree resource, but they will be supported in a future release. To create or update smart device groups, log in to the Secure Endpoint Console.

Permissions

To use the endpoint, the Manage permission for Device Groups and folders must be assigned to your API token.

Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Device Group Tree

tags.description:
The Reach resource allows you to create and query Run Script requests, and query and cancel outstanding Run Script actions. The Reach resource can also be used to query and download scripts from the Absolute Reach Script Library.

The Reach resource is supported on devices that are assigned an Absolute Resilience license.

Absolute Reach is supported on Windows and Mac devices with an active Secure Endpoint Agent that is regularly connecting to the Absolute Monitoring Center.

Scripts must be uploaded to the Reach Library using the Secure Endpoint Console.

For information about running scripts and the Reach Library, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Running scripts on devices
  • Getting started with the Script Library

Permissions

The Run permission for Reach Script is required to use all Reach endpoints.

Note that if you want to add this permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Reach

tags.description: Prevent false positives by defining which file extensions and folders are excluded from EDD scans. These exclusions apply to all devices in your account. Match scores will be recalculated and updated once the next full scan is complete.
tags.name: Scan Exclusions

tags.description:
The Freeze resource allows you to create and query Freeze requests, remove Freeze requests for devices that are frozen, and cancel outstanding scheduled and offline Freeze requests. It also allows you to create, query, update, and delete Freeze messages, which are the messages that are shown on a device when it is frozen.

The Freeze resource is supported on devices that are assigned an Absolute Control or Absolute Resilience license.

On-demand Freeze requests are supported on Windows and Mac devices with an active Secure Endpoint Agent that is regularly connecting to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
On-demand Freeze requests are also supported on Chromebook devices with an active Absolute for Chromebooks extension and Chromebook devices that synced with the Secure Endpoint Console.

Scheduled Freeze requests are supported on Windows and Mac devices with an active Secure Endpoint Agent that is regularly connecting to the Absolute Monitoring Center.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Freezing devices
  • Removing Freeze requests

Permissions

The View permission for Freeze Device is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `POST /v3/actions/freeze/messages`
  • `GET /v3/actions/freeze/messages`
  • `GET /v3/actions/freeze/messages/{messageUid}`
  • `PUT /v3/actions/freeze/messages/{messageUid}`
  • `DELETE /v3/actions/freeze/messages/{messageUid}`

    • The Perform permission for Freeze Device is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `POST /v3/actions/requests/freeze`
  • `POST /v3/actions/freeze/remove-freeze`

    • The Perform permission for both Freeze Device and Remove Freeze is required to use the following endpoint:

  • `GET /v3/actions/freeze/requests/{requestUid}`

    • Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Freeze

tags.description:
Get Endpoint Data Discovery match details

Get detailed information about historical Endpoint Data Discovery (EDD) scan results for all devices.

Use the query parameters to filter the results by device, file details, match information, and scan date.
tags.name: Historical Match

tags.description: description
tags.name: Validate webservice

tags.description:
The Custom Data resource allows you to retrieve, add, and delete Custom Data data point configurations. You can also enable and disable data points, see the scan results for enabled data points, and see errors that occurred while scanning for the data points on devices.

The Custom Data resource is supported on devices that are assigned an Absolute Resilience license.

To add a data point configuration, use POST /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/configs.
To enable or disable the data point in the Custom Data policy, use PUT /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/configs/{cdcConfigurationUid}.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Getting started with Custom Data policies
  • Managing Custom Data data points

Permissions

No specific permission is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `GET /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/datapoints`
  • `GET /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/datapoints/devices/{deviceUid}`

    • The View permssion for Custom Data Collection is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `GET /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/configs/{cdcConfigurationUid}`
  • `GET /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/configs`

    • The Manage permission for Custom Data Collection is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `PUT /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/configs/{cdcConfigurationUid}`
  • `DELETE /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/configs/{cdcConfigurationUid}`
  • `POST /v3/configurations/custom-data-collector/configs`

    • Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Custom Data

tags.description: The Reporting License resources allow you to get licenses of of your account devices
tags.name: License

tags.description:
The Policy Groups resource allows you to create, query, update, and delete policy groups, and change the activation status of policies. You can also move devices between policy groups.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Getting started with policy groups
  • Managing policy groups
  • Moving devices between policy groups
  • Activating policies
  • Deactivating policies

To get the list of devices in a custom policy group, use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint and filter by `policyGroupName` or `policyGroupUid`. To get the list of devices in the Global Policy Group, use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint and filter by `policyGroupName` or `policyGroupUidEmpty=true`.

Permissions

To use the `GET /v3/configurations/policy-groups` endpoint, the View permission for Policies must be assigned to your API token. To use all other endpoints, the Manage permission for Policies is required.

Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Policy Groups

tags.description:
The SIEM Event Reporting resource returns a list of event records and their corresponding data. It is supported on devices that are assigned an Absolute Control or Absolute Resilience license.

Before you can use this resource, you need to log in to the Secure Endpoint Console, select the events to send to your Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solution, and enable the SIEM integration. You do not need to download and install the SIEM Connector.

For more information about SIEM integration, see the following topics in the console help:

  • SIEM integration
  • Setting up integration with a SIEM application

SIEM events are only retained for 72 hours.

Permissions

To use this endpoint, the Manage permission for SIEM integration must be assigned to your API token.

Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: SIEM Event Reporting

tags.description:
The RSVP resource is not available if your login URL is https://cc.fr1.absolutegov.com.

The Lenovo RSVP resource allows you to remotely manage the BIOS supervisor password on select Windows devices.

Manage Supervisor Password requests are only supported on Lenovo ThinkPad, ThinkCentre, and ThinkStation devices manufactured in 2020 or later that are assigned an Absolute Control or Absolute Resilience license.

The following prerequisites must also be met:

  • devices have an active Secure Endpoint Agent that is regularly connecting to the Absolute Monitoring Center
  • devices have no other pending firmware device action requests
  • devices do not have an open theft report

Permissions

To use the endpoint, the Manage permission for Manage Supervisor Password must be assigned to your API token.

Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: RSVP

tags.description:
The Software Reporting resource returns a flat list of device records and the corresponding software application data for each device you have access to or that meets your filtering criteria.

Permissions

To use an endpoint, the View permission for Software reports must be assigned to your API token.

Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Software Reporting

tags.description: The request endpoints have been moved to their corresponding resources. The URIs for requests have not changed.
tags.name: Requests

tags.description:
The Device Missing resource allows you to report devices missing or found, and query devices that have been reported missing.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Reporting devices missing or stolen
  • Reporting missing device found

Permissions

To use the `GET` endpoint, the View permission for Missing Device must be assigned to your API token. To use a `POST` endpoint, the Manage permission for Missing Device is required.

Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Missing Devices

tags.description:
The Custom Fields resource allows you to insert, retrieve, and update the values of the Fixed Device Fields and Custom Device Fields associated with a specific device. It can also be used to retrieve Device Field definitions.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Managing Device Fields
  • Editing Device Fields data
Permissions

The View permission for Device Fields is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `GET /v3/configurations/customfields/devices/{deviceUid}/{cdfUid}`
  • `GET /v3/configurations/customfields/devices/{deviceUid}`

    • The Manage permission for Device Fields is required to use the following endpoint:

  • `PUT /v3/configurations/customfields/devices/{deviceUid}`

    • The Manage permission for Device Field Definition is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `GET /v3/configurations/customfields/definitions`
  • `GET /v3/configurations/customfields/definitions/{cdfUid}`

    • Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Custom Fields

tags.description: Detect file content that may be at-risk by going to Device Policies and activating the Endpoint Data Discovery (EDD) policy on your devices. Go to Reports to analyze the collected EDD data and identify devices that may require remedial action to secure the data.
tags.name: Performing Endpoint Data Discovery scan for managed devices in this Policy Group

tags.description:
The Playbook resource allows you to submit Run Playbook requests to remotely recover a Windows device when a fatal system error prevents it from booting into Windows. You can also run a playbook to repair or recover a device when the operating system is operational.

The following playbooks are available:

  • File operations (add or delete)
  • Set/remove registry key
  • Restore golden image
  • Run script
For more information about these playbooks, see Running playbooks in the console help.

To run a playbook on a device, it must meet a number of system requirements. Also, the Playbooks policy must be enabled, and the device must be fully provisioned to run playbooks. For more information, see Getting started with Playbooks policies in the console help.

Permissions

To use the POST endpoint, the Perform permission for Run playbooks must be assigned to your API token. To use the GET endpoints, the View permission for Run playbooks is required.

Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Playbook

tags.description:
The Agents resource allows you to configure the setting for automatic agent updates, and set the default agent version if automatic agent updates are disabled. You can also query the policy groups assigned to a particular agent version.

Permissions

The Manage permission for Version Control is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `GET /v3/configurations/agents/{agentVersion}/policy-groups`
  • `PUT /v3/configurations/agents/{agentVersion}/policy-groups`
  • `PATCH /v3/configurations/agents/settings`

    • Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Agents

tags.description:
The Device Groups resource allows you to query existing device groups.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Getting started with device groups
  • Viewing a device's device groups

Permissions

No specific permission is required to use the Device Groups endpoints.
tags.name: Device Groups

tags.description:
The File Delete resource allows you to create and query File Delete requests, and query and cancel File Delete requests. If applicable, you can also download the Certificate of Sanitization associated with a device's File Delete request.

The File Delete resource is supported on devices that are assigned an Absolute Control or Absolute Resilience license.

A File Delete request remotely deletes files and folders from your Windows and Mac devices to protect your organization's confidential and sensitive data. Depending on the criteria included in a request, you can:

  • delete individual files, folders, or file types
  • use patterns to delete items in multiple locations
  • wipe devices by deleting all sensitive data
    For Windows devices, you can also disable the operating system. This type of File Delete is available for both encrypted and unencrypted devices.

File Delete requests are supported on Windows and Mac that are devices regularly connecting to the Absolute Monitoring Center.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Deleting files from devices
  • Wiping devices (Delete All Files)
  • Downloading a Certificate of Sanitization

Permissions

The View permission for Delete File is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `GET /v3/actions/requests/file-delete/{requestUid}`
  • `GET /v3/actions/requests/file-delete`
  • `POST /v3/actions/file-delete/get-actions/{requestUid}`
  • `POST /v3/actions/file-delete/get-actions`
  • `GET /v3/actions/file-delete/certificates/{deviceUid}/{certificateUid}`

    • The Perform permission for Delete File is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `POST /v3/actions/requests/file-delete`
  • `POST /v3/actions/file-delete/cancel-actions/{requestUid}`

    • Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: File Delete

tags.description:
The Device Reporting resource supports requesting, querying, and reporting device information, which includes hardware, device platforms, and features that your organization has purchased.

Permissions

To use an endpoint, the View permission for Device reports must be assigned to your API token. However, if you want to view data in the following parameters, additional permissions are required:

  • `geodata`: View permission for Geolocation
  • `geodata.location.point`: Address-level view permission for Geolocation
  • `deviceFreezeStatus.passcode`: Perform permission for Remove Freeze
  • `deviceFreezeActionStatus.statuses.status.passcode`: Perform permission for Remove Freeze

Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Device Reporting

tags.description:
The Wipe resource allows you to create and query Wipe requests, and query and cancel Wipe actions. You can also download the Certificate of Sanitization associated with a device's Wipe request.

The Wipe resource is supported on devices that are assigned an Absolute Control or Absolute Resilience license.

A Wipe remotely removes all sensitive data from an encrypted device before you reuse, resell, or dispose of it. For Mac devices, the request also unenrolls the device. For Windows devices, unenrolling the device is optional.

Wipe requests are supported on the following devices:

  • Windows 10 and 11 devices with the following attributes:
    • Encrypted by BitLocker
    • Encryption Status set to either Encrypted or Used Space Encrypted
  • Mac devices with the following attributes
    • Encrypted by FileVault
    • Encryption Status set to Encrypted
    • Single drive that is fully encrypted

Windows and Mac devices must be regularly connecting to the Absolute Monitoring Center.

For more information, see the following topics in the console help:

  • Wiping devices
  • Downloading a Certificate of Sanitization

Permissions

The View permission for Wipe Device is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `POST /v3/actions/wipe/get-actions/{requestUid}`
  • `POST /v3/actions/wipe/get-actions`
  • `GET /v3/actions/requests/wipe/{requestUid}`
  • `GET /v3/actions/requests/wipe`
  • `GET /v3/actions/wipe/certificates/{deviceUid}/{certificateUid}`

    • The Perform permission for Wipe Device is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `POST /v3/actions/requests/wipe`
  • `POST /v3/actions/wipe/cancel-actions/{requestUid}`

    • Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Wipe

tags.description:
The Unenroll resource allows you to create and query Unenroll Device requests, and query Unenroll Device actions.

For more information about unenrolling devices from your account, see Unenrolling devices from your account in the console help.

Permissions

The View permission for Unenroll Device is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `POST /v3/actions/unenroll/get-actions/{requestUid}`
  • `POST /v3/actions/unenroll/get-actions`

    • The Perform permission for Unenroll Device is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `GET /v3/actions/requests/unenroll/{requestUid}`
  • `GET /v3/actions/requests/unenroll`
  • `POST /v3/actions/requests/unenroll`

    • Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Unenroll

tags.description:
The Messaging resource allows you to create and query Send Message requests, and query and cancel outstanding Send Message actions.

You can submit a Send Message request to share important news and announcements with device users.
Messages can be displayed in a dialog or as a full screen message, and you can schedule them for a future date, if desired.

The Messaging resource is supported on devices that are assigned an Absolute Control or Absolute Resilience license.

Send Message requests are supported on the following devices:

  • Windows devices running Windows 10 or higher
  • Mac devices running macOS 13 or higher
  • Chromebook devices running the current version of Chrome OS.

Windows and Mac devices must be regularly connecting to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
Chromebook devices must be running the current version of the Chromebook extension and must be synced with the Secure Endpoint Console.

For more information about Send Message requests, see Sending messages in the console help.

Permissions

The View permission for Send Message is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `GET /v3/actions/requests/eum`
  • `GET /v3/actions/requests/eum/{requestUid}`
  • `GET /v3/actions/freeze/messages/{messageUid}`
  • `POST /v3/actions/eum/get-actions/{requestUid}`
  • `POST /v3/actions/eum/get-actions`
  • `GET /v3/actions/eum/messages`
  • `GET /v3/actions/eum/messages/{messageUid}`

    • The Manage permission for Send Message is required to use the following endpoints:

  • `POST /v3/actions/requests/eum `
  • `POST /v3/actions/eum/cancel-actions/{requestUid}`

    • Note that if you want to add a permission, you'll need to create a new API token. You can't add a permission to an existing API token.
tags.name: Messaging

isEnabled.description:
If `true`, the data point is enabled in the Custom Data policy
If `false`, the data point is not enabled in the Custom Data policy

fieldName.description:
The user-defined unique field name for the data point
If an existing data point configuration uses the specified `fieldName`, the existing data point configuration is overwritten
Do not use an existing `fieldName` if `dataType` is different - specify a new `fieldName` instead
Only accepts alphanumeric characters

displayName.description:
The display name for the data point
Must be unique
The validation for matching `displayName` is case insensitive, BatteryHealth and batteryHealth are considered the same
If a display name is not assigned when the data point configuration is added, `fieldName` is used

CreateCDCConfiguration.description: An array of objects, each object represents a new data point configuration that is being added

accountUid.description: The system-defined unique identifier of your accountUid

accountEnforced.description: Flag whether the account is license-enforced or not

cdfUid.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the Device Field

cdfFieldKey.description: The system-defined unique identifier assigned to the Device Field for the specified device. This parameter was used as an alternative identifier in Classic Absolute when `cdfUid` was not defined.

cdfFieldName.description: The name of the Device Field

cdfFieldValue.description: The value assigned to the Device Field for the specified device

categoryCode.description:
The type of Device Field
  • `PREDEFINED`: predefined by Absolute (Fixed Device Field)
  • `ESNCOLUMN`: predefined by Absolute (Fixed Device Field)
  • `UDF`: created and defined by a user (Custom Device Field)
  • `RDF`: deprecated
  • `WEBUSAGE`: deprecated

type.description: The data type of the Device Field

deviceUid.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the device

accountUid.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the Absolute account

esn.description: The system-defined unique identifier (Absolute Identifier) assigned to the Secure Endpoint Agent installed on the device

deviceName.description: The name assigned to the device

deviceSerialNumber.description: The manufacturer-defined unique identifier assigned to the device

userName.description: The unique username of the user that was logged in to the device at the time of the agent call

installPath.description: The location where the application is installed

installDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) that the application was installed

osName.description: The operating system installed on the device

major.description: The major version of the application installed on the device, if applicable

minor.description: The minor version of the application installed on the device, if applicable

deviceAppId.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the application

appId.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the application

appVersion.description: The normalized version of the application installed on the device

appOriginalVersion.description: The original version of the application installed on the device

firstDetectDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) the indicated version of the application was first detected on the device

lastScanDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) of the most recent Installed Software (SNG) scan

statusCode.description:
The status code for the current Freeze status of the device
Returns `FRZN` if the device is frozen by a Freeze of any type.
If the parameter is returned with any other value, or not returned at all, the device is not currently frozen.

displayStatusCode.description:
The status code for the current Freeze status of the device
Returns `FRZN` if the device is frozen by a Freeze of any type.
If the parameter is returned with any other value, or not returned at all, the device is not currently frozen.

statusName.description:
The current Freeze status of the device
Returns `Frozen` if the device is frozen by a Freeze of any type.
If the parameter is returned with any other value, or not returned at all, the device is not currently frozen.

passCode.description: The unfreeze code that can be used to remove the current Freeze from the device sooner than waiting until the device's next agent call

displayPassCode.description: The unfreeze code that can be used to remove the current Freeze from the device sooner than waiting until the device's next agent call

changedDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) the status was last updated for the current Freeze on the device

DeviceFreezeStatus.description: An object containing information about the current Freeze status of the device

id.description: The identifier of the keyboard

name.description: The name of the keyboard

layout.description: The layout of the keyboard indicated by a free-form string

pnpDeviceId.description: The Windows Plug and Play device identifier of the keyboard

numberOfFunctionKeys.description: The number of functions keys on the keyboard

driver.description: The name of the keyboard driver

Keyboard.description: An array of objects, each object represents one of the device's keyboards

applicationName.description: The name of the application in the Application Resilience policy

trigger.description: The reason the Application Resilience policy was run on the device

version.description: The version of the application that is installed on the device

lastUpdatedDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) the results of the status check were last updated in the Absolute Monitoring Center

executionCompletedDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) the status of the application was checked on the device

status.description:
The status of the Application Resilience policy
  • `Enabled`: the Application Resilience policy is enabled on the device
  • `Disabled`: the Report only option is enabled in the Application Resilience policy
  • `NoCurrentData`: the device has a status of Compliant, no repairs were attempted
  • `NotCompliant`: the device has a status of Not Compliant

repairStatus.description:
The status of any attempted repairs
  • `RepairDisabled`: the Report only option is enabled in the Application Resilience policy
  • `NoRepairs`: the device has a status of Compliant so no repairs were attempted
  • `Success`: all attempted repairs were successful and the device has a status of Compliant
  • `Failure`: the attempted repairs were not successful and the device has a status of Not Compliant
  • `PendingReboot`: a repair was attempted but the device needs to restart to finish the process and the device has a status on Not Compliant

statusDetails.description:
Detailed information on why the Secure Endpoint Agent is unable to repair or reinstall the application when it's not functioning correctly or is missing
See Understanding status details for a persisted application in the Online help for more information on interpreting this error

repairCount.description: The total number of repairs that succeeded on the device over the last 30 days

reinstallCount.description: The total number of reinstallations that succeeded on the device over the last 30 days

failedCount.description: The total number of repairs and reinstallations that failed on the device over the last 30 days

persistentEventCount.description: The total number of repairs and reinstallations attempted on the device over the last 30 days

lastKnownHealthyStatusDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) the Secure Endpoint Agent last detected the application changed from a non-compliant (unhealthy) status to a compliant (healthy) status

lastKnownCorruptStatusDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) the Secure Endpoint Agent last detected the application changed from a compliant (healthy) status to a non-compliant (unhealthy) status

lastEventCountUpdatedDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) the Application Resilience event counts were last updated in the Absolute Monitoring Center

totalDevices.description: The total number of devices included in the request

pending.description: The number of devices in the request with a status of Pending

processing.description: The number of devices in the request with a status of Processing

completed.description: The number of devices in the request that have a status of Succeeded

canceled.description: The number of devices in the request that have a status of Canceled

failed.description: The number of devices in the request that have a status of Failed

requestId.description: The system-defined identifier for the request

requestUid.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the Device Action request

requestStatus.description:
The status of the request
  • `Init`: all devices in the request have an action status of Pending
  • `Canceled`: the request was canceled by the requester while pending approval
  • `Completed`: all the devices in the request have an action status of Completed, Succeeded, Failed, or Canceled
  • `InProgress`: at least one device in the request has an action status of Processing
  • `Failed`: the request failed, the request was declined, or the request was auto declined
  • `Scheduled`: the request is scheduled to take place in the future and all requests have an action status of Pending or Ready
    Applies to Send Message requests only
  • `PendingApproval`: the request is waiting to be approved
    Applies to dual approval requests only

createdDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) that the request was created

updatedDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) that the request was last updated

requester.description: The username of the entity that created the request

excludeMissingDevices.description:
Indicates whether devices that have been reported Missing should be excluded from the request
  • `true`: devices reported Missing are excluded from the request
  • `false`: devices reported Missing are included in the request

groupType.description:
The type of device group
  • `Fixed`: static device group

groupMemberIds.description: The list of `deviceUids` that belong to the device group

items.description: The list of `deviceUids` that belong to the device group

CreateDeviceGroupTreeRequest_DeviceGroup.description:
An object containing details about the static device group

If you're creating a folder, you can omit this object.

x.description: The estimated latitude (in degrees) where the device is located

y.description: The estimated longitude (in degrees) where the device is located

type.description: The type of geolocation data used

coordinates.description: An array containing the estimated latitude and longitude (in degrees) where the device is located

items.description: An array containing the estimated latitude and longitude (in degrees) where the device is located

GeoJsonPoint.description: An object containing the device's last location coordinates

message.description: The reason the devices were ineligible for the request

invalidValues.description: The system-defined unique identifiers of the devices that were ineligible for the request

items.description: The system-defined unique identifiers of the devices that were ineligible for the request

CreateRsvpResponseError.description: An array of objects, each object represents one reason why the devices were ineligible for the request

cdfUid.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the Device Field

cdfFieldKey.description:
The system-defined unique identifier assigned to the Device Field for the specified device. This parameter was used as an alternative identifier in Classic Absolute when cdfUid was not defined.

If specified in the request body, the value will be ignored.

cdfFieldValue.description: The value assigned to the Device Field for the specified device

deviceUids.description: The system-defined unique identifiers of the devices included in the request

removeScheduled.description:
Indicates whether the Scheduled Freeze request should be removed
  • `true`: in addition to creating a Remove Freeze request for devices with a status of `Frozen on Schedule`, deletes the Scheduled Freeze request for devices with a status of `Freeze Requested` and `Freeze Scheduled`
  • `false` (default): a Remove Freeze request is created for the devices but the Scheduled Freeze request is not deleted

removeOffline.description:
Indicates whether the Conditional - Offline Freeze request should be removed
  • `true`: In addition to creating a Remove Freeze request for devices with a status of `Frozen by Condition: Offline`, removes Offline Freeze requests from devices with a status of `Freeze Requested` or `Freeze Condition - Offline Set`
  • `false` (default): a Remove Freeze request is created for the devices but the Conditional - Offline Freeze request is not deleted
Conditional - Offline Freeze requests have been deprecated

  • `CDF`: Custom Field

statuses.description: An array of objects, each object represents one Freeze request associated with the device

score.description:
Each Freeze request on the device is assigned a weight based on its status. The score is the sum of the weights assigned to each Freeze request.
The sum is taken from these statuses:

Conditional - Offline Freeze requests have been replaced by Offline Freeze rules.

  • 0: The device has no outstanding Freeze requests.
  • 5: An Offline Freeze rule has been applied to the device or a Conditional - Offline Freeze request has been created for the device and the offline timer has started counting down. With each successful agent check-in, the timer resets. If the device doesn't check in to the Absolute Monitoring Center before the timer expires, the device is frozen.
  • 10: A Scheduled Freeze request has been created for the device.
  • 15: An On-demand Freeze request has been created for the device.
  • 50: The offline timer has expired since the last time the device checked in to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
  • 60: The scheduled timer has expired on the device. If Freeze request has been downloaded to the device, the device will be frozen the next time it is powered on. If the Freeze request has not been downloaded to the device, the device will be frozen the next time it checks in to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
  • 100: The device has been frozen by an Offline Freeze rule or by a Conditional - Offline Freeze request.
  • 200: The device has been frozen by a Scheduled Freeze request.
  • 300: The device has been frozen by an On-demand Freeze request.

DeviceFreezeActionFrameworkInfo.description: An object containing information about all of the outstanding Freeze requests associated with the device

newPassword.description:
The new supervisor password you want to set on the device
Required when `actionType` is `CREATE_SUPERVISOR_PASSWORD` or `UPDATE_SUPERVISOR_PASSWORD`.
  • When the devices' `rsvpStatus.version` is `1.0`, the password must be 1 to 64 characters and can only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters
  • When the devices' `rsvpStatus.version` is `2.x` and `rsvpStatus.isStrongPasswordRequired` is `false`, the password must be 1 to 128 characters, can contain uppercase and lowercase alphanumeric characters as well as special characters (ASCII only)
  • When the devices' `rsvpStatus.version` is `2.x` and `rsvpStatus.isStrongPasswordRequired` is `true`, the password must be 8 to 128 characters, can contain uppercase and lowercase alphanumeric characters, special characters (ASCII only), and must contain:
    • at least one uppercase character
    • at least one lowercase character
    • at least one numeric character

currentPassword.description:
The devices' current supervisor password
Required when actionType is UPDATE_SUPERVISOR_PASSWORD or DELETE_SUPERVISOR_PASSWORD and the devices' rsvpStatus.status is RemotelySetSecured or LocallySet.

If this field is required, all devices in the request must have the same current supervisor password. Create separate requests for each different password.

forceReenterPassword.description:
Indicates whether the password will be required to make future changes to the supervisor password
Use when `actionType` is `CREATE_SUPERVISOR_PASSWORD`.
  • `true`: the password will be required to make changes to the supervisor password through the RSVP endpoint or on the physical device
  • `false` (default): the password will not be required changes to make changes to the supervisor password through the RSVP endpoint or on the physical device

This parameter cannot be changed after you create a supervisor password. Instead, you must remove the supervisor password, then create a new supervisor password.

actionType.description:
The type of supervisor password action
  • `CREATE_SUPERVISOR_PASSWORD`: create a new supervisor password
    Use when devices' `rsvpStatus.status` is `Unset`.
  • `UPDATE_SUPERVISOR_PASSWORD`: update an existing supervisor password
    Use when the devices' `rsvpStatus.status` is `RemotelySet`, `RemotelySetSecured`, or `LocallySet`.
  • `REMOVE_SUPERVISOR_PASSWORD`: remove an existing supervisor password
    Use when devices' `rsvpStatus.status` is `RemotelySet`, `RemotelySetSecured`, or `LocallySet`.

NonCompliantReasonPropertyList.description:
An array of objects, each object contains details about the `observed` status. The property/value pairs depend on the `type`. Note that for the `appResilience` type, there is an array for each resilient application.
  • geolocation properties:
    • `geolocation`: The name of the location
    • `status`: An indication of whether the device was inside or outside the location
    • `hours`: The number of hours the device was inside or outside the location
  • geofence properties:
    • `geofence`: The name of the geofence
    • `status`: An indication of whether the device was inside or outside the geofence
    • `hours`: The number of hours the device was inside or outside the geofence
  • encryptionStatus properties:
    • `status`: the encryption status of the device
    • `drives`: The drives that the encryption status pertains to
  • antivirusProtectionStatus property:
    • `status`: The anti-malware status of the device
  • appResilience properties:
    • `appName`: The name of the application
    • `status`: The Application Resilience status of the application
  • osVersion properties:
    • `osType`: The operating system (OS) of the device
    • `version`: The OS version

requestStatus.description:
The status of the request
  • `Init`: all devices in the request have an action status of Pending
  • `Canceled`: the request was canceled by the requester while pending approval
  • `Completed`: all the devices in the request have an action status of Completed, Succeeded, Failed, or Canceled
  • `InProgress`: at least one device in the request has an action status of Processing
  • `Failed`: the request failed, the request was declined, or the request was auto declined
  • `Scheduled`: the request is scheduled to take place in the future and all requests have an action status of Pending or Ready
    Applies to Send Message requests only
  • `PendingApproval`: the request is waiting to be approved
    Applies to dual approval requests only

agentStatus.description:
The operating condition of the Secure Endpoint Agent on the device
  • `A`: the agent is active and has connected to the Absolute Monitoring Center
    For Chromebook devices, the device has synced with the Absolute Monitoring Center or the device has synced and the Absolute for Chromebooks extension has been deployed to the device.
  • `D`: the agent is disabled and is either flagged for removal or has been removed from the device
    For Chromebook devices, the Chromebook extension is disabled on the device
  • `I`: the agent is inactive and has not yet connected to the Absolute Monitoring Center
    Does not apply to Chromebook devices

deviceFreezeReportingStatuses.description:
An array of strings, each string represents the status for one of the Freeze requests currently associated with the device

Conditional - Offline Freeze requests have been replaced by Offline Freeze rules.

  • FreezeRequested: An On-demand Freeze request has been created for the device.
  • FreezeScheduled: A Scheduled Freeze request has been created for the device.
  • FreezeConditionOfflineSet: An Offline Freeze rule has been applied to the device has been created for the device and the offline timer has started counting down. With each successful agent check-in, the timer resets. If the device doesn't check in to the Absolute Monitoring Center before the timer expires, the device is frozen.
  • FreezeConditionSet: A Conditional - Offline Freeze request has been created for the device and the offline timer has started counting down. With each successful agent check-in, the timer resets. If the device doesn't check in to the Absolute Monitoring Center before the timer expires, the device is frozen.
  • OfflineTimerExpired: The offline timer has expired since the last time the device checked in to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
  • ScheduledTimerExpired: The scheduled timer has expired on the device. If Freeze request has been downloaded to the device, the device will be frozen the next time it is powered on. If the Freeze request has not been downloaded to the device, the device will be frozen the next time it checks in to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
  • Frozen: The device has been frozen by an On-demand Freeze request.
  • FrozenOnSchedule: The device has been frozen by a Scheduled Freeze request.
  • FrozenByConditionOffline: The device has been frozen by an Offline Freeze rule.
  • FrozenByCondition: The device has been frozen by a Conditional - Offline Freeze request.

items.description:
An array of strings, each string represents the status for one of the Freeze requests currently associated with the device

Conditional - Offline Freeze requests have been replaced by Offline Freeze rules.

  • FreezeRequested: An On-demand Freeze request has been created for the device.
  • FreezeScheduled: A Scheduled Freeze request has been created for the device.
  • FreezeConditionOfflineSet: An Offline Freeze rule has been applied to the device has been created for the device and the offline timer has started counting down. With each successful agent check-in, the timer resets. If the device doesn't check in to the Absolute Monitoring Center before the timer expires, the device is frozen.
  • FreezeConditionSet: A Conditional - Offline Freeze request has been created for the device and the offline timer has started counting down. With each successful agent check-in, the timer resets. If the device doesn't check in to the Absolute Monitoring Center before the timer expires, the device is frozen.
  • OfflineTimerExpired: The offline timer has expired since the last time the device checked in to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
  • ScheduledTimerExpired: The scheduled timer has expired on the device. If Freeze request has been downloaded to the device, the device will be frozen the next time it is powered on. If the Freeze request has not been downloaded to the device, the device will be frozen the next time it checks in to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
  • Frozen: The device has been frozen by an On-demand Freeze request.
  • FrozenOnSchedule: The device has been frozen by a Scheduled Freeze request.
  • FrozenByConditionOffline: The device has been frozen by an Offline Freeze rule.
  • FrozenByCondition: The device has been frozen by a Conditional - Offline Freeze request.

status.description:
The status of the Freeze request

Conditional - Offline Freeze requests have been replaced by Offline Freeze rules.

  • FreezeRequested: An On-demand Freeze request has been created for the device.
  • FreezeScheduled: A Scheduled Freeze request has been created for the device.
  • FreezeConditionOfflineSet: An Offline Freeze rule has been applied to the device has been created for the device and the offline timer has started counting down. With each successful agent check-in, the timer resets. If the device doesn't check in to the Absolute Monitoring Center before the timer expires, the device is frozen.
  • FreezeConditionSet: A Conditional - Offline Freeze request has been created for the device and the offline timer has started counting down. With each successful agent check-in, the timer resets. If the device doesn't check in to the Absolute Monitoring Center before the timer expires, the device is frozen.
  • OfflineTimerExpired: The offline timer has expired since the last time the device checked in to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
  • ScheduledTimerExpired: The scheduled timer has expired on the device. If Freeze request has been downloaded to the device, the device will be frozen the next time it is powered on. If the Freeze request has not been downloaded to the device, the device will be frozen the next time it checks in to the Absolute Monitoring Center.
  • Frozen: The device has been frozen by an On-demand Freeze request.
  • FrozenOnSchedule: The device has been frozen by a Scheduled Freeze request.
  • FrozenByConditionOffline: The device has been frozen by an Offline Freeze rule.
  • FrozenByCondition: The device has been frozen by a Conditional - Offline Freeze request.

  • LocallySet: The password was set locally on the device and changes to the supervisor password require the current password.

patterns.description:
Specifies the files, folders, or file types to delete
For example, the following patterns are supported:
  • filename.extension: Delete a file in any location
  • folder name/filename: Delete a file in a location
  • folder name/: Delete a folder
  • *.extension: Delete all files of the same file type
The following wildcards are supported:
  • *: Matches zero or more consecutive characters, except slashes and backslashes (Windows only)
  • ?: Matches any single character
  • [abc]: Matches any single character within the brackets
  • [a-z] or [0-9]: Matches any single character within the specified range (locale-dependent)
  • **: Recursively matches one or more directories within the current directory

items.description:
Specifies the files, folders, or file types to delete
For example, the following patterns are supported:
  • filename.extension: Delete a file in any location
  • folder name/filename: Delete a file in a location
  • folder name/: Delete a folder
  • *.extension: Delete all files of the same file type
The following wildcards are supported:
  • *: Matches zero or more consecutive characters, except slashes and backslashes (Windows only)
  • ?: Matches any single character
  • [abc]: Matches any single character within the brackets
  • [a-z] or [0-9]: Matches any single character within the specified range (locale-dependent)
  • **: Recursively matches one or more directories within the current directory

actionStatus.description:
The action status of the request on the device
  • `Pending`: the action has not been downloaded to the device
  • `Ineligible`: the device is ineligible for the action
  • `Failed`: either the system or the device is unable to perform the action
  • `Canceled`: a user canceled the action
  • `Succeeded`: the action was processed and completed successfully on the device
    Applies to Run Script and Cryptographic Wipe requests only
  • `Completed`: the action was processed on the device
    Applies to Freeze, Unenroll Device, Delete File, and Send Message requests only
  • `Processing`: the action is in progress on the device, but it has not completed yet
  • `Ready`: the action was downloaded to the device, but it is scheduled to take place in the future
    Applies to Freeze and Send Message requests only

type.description: The device attribute responsible for the device's non-compliant status. The following types are supported: `geolocation`, `geofence`, `encryptionStatus`, `antivirusProtectionStatus`, `appResilience`, and `osVersion`

condition.description: The condition that the non-compliant status is based on

observed.description: The device's status with respect to the condition. For more details, see `properties`.

properties.description:
An array of objects, each object contains details about the `observed` status. The property/value pairs depend on the `type`. Note that for the `appResilience` type, there is an array for each resilient application.
  • geolocation properties:
    • `geolocation`: The name of the location
    • `status`: An indication of whether the device was inside or outside the location
    • `hours`: The number of hours the device was inside or outside the location
  • geofence properties:
    • `geofence`: The name of the geofence
    • `status`: An indication of whether the device was inside or outside the geofence
    • `hours`: The number of hours the device was inside or outside the geofence
  • encryptionStatus properties:
    • `status`: the encryption status of the device
    • `drives`: The drives that the encryption status pertains to
  • antivirusProtectionStatus property:
    • `status`: The anti-malware status of the device
  • appResilience properties:
    • `appName`: The name of the application
    • `status`: The Application Resilience status of the application
  • osVersion properties:
    • `osType`: The operating system (OS) of the device
    • `version`: The OS version

items.description:
An array of objects, each object contains details about the `observed` status. The property/value pairs depend on the `type`. Note that for the `appResilience` type, there is an array for each resilient application.

  • geofence properties:

actionStatus.description:
The action status of the request on the device
  • The `actionStatus` for Unenroll device requests transition from `Pending` to `Processing` almost immediately
  • `Ineligible`: The device is ineligible for the action
  • `Failed`: Either the system or the device is unable to perform the action
  • `Canceled`: A user canceled the action
    In most cases, the `actionStatus` doesn't remain `Pending` long enough to cancel the action
  • `Succeeded`: Not applicable
    Applies to Run Script and Cryptographic Wipe requests only
  • `Completed`: The Unenroll device request was submitted successfully and the device's `agentStatus` is set to `D` (disabled)
  • `Processing`: The `actionStatus` for Unenroll device requests transition from `Processing` to `Completed` almost immediately
  • `Ready`: Not applicable
    Applies to Send Message requests only

One of two acceleration values
The sensitivity of the pointing device doubles (toggles from the first to the second value) when the pointing device moves a distance greater than this threshold value

The address or location of the device
Maps to the Location field in the Google Admin console

Maps to the Asset ID field in the Google Admin console

gacDevicePlatformVersion.description:
The build number and channel of the device's Chrome OS operating system
Maps to the Platform version field in the Google Admin console

gacDeviceBootMode.description:
The boot mode of the Chromebook device
Maps to the Boot mode field in the Google Admin console
  • `Verified`: the device is running a valid version of the Chrome OS operating system.
  • `Dev`: the device is running in developer mode, which gives device users access to a "root" shell. Google cannot verify the operating system in this mode.
For more information, refer to the Chromebook developer documentation

The full path of the OU that the Chromebook belongs to
Maps to the Organizational unit field in the Google Admin console

gacDeviceNotes.description:
Special information about the device
Maps to the Notes field in the Google Admin console

gacDeviceAutoUpdateExpiration.description:
The date when the Chromebook device will no longer receive the automatic Chromebook updates that enhance both the device and its software
Maps to the Auto-update expiration field in the Google Admin console

gacDeviceDeviceId.description:
The enterprise device identifier that uniquely identifies the Chromebook
Maps to the Device ID field in the Google Admin console

chromebookStatus.description:
The status of the Chromebook extension on the device
  • `Pending`: your Google account has been added to the Secure Endpoint Console and the devices organizational unit (OU) has been selected but the extension has not been deployed to the device yet
  • `Installed`: your Google account has been added to the Secure Endpoint Console, an authorized user has logged in to the Chromebook device, and the Chromebook extension has been deployed to the device
  • `Disabled`: the device has been unenrolled from the Secure Endpoint Console

recentUsers.description:
A comma-delimited list of users that have logged into the device, even if the users are not configured with the Chromebook extension
The most recent users are shown first
Maps to the Recent users field in the Google Admin console

The property name and value

Refer to `playbookOptions` in the playbook template for details.

For the property `isBreakGlass`, specify `true` to run a user-initated playbook, or `false` to run a system-initiated playbook. For more information, see Running playbooks in the console help.

requestUid.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the Device Action request

requestStatus.description:
The status of the request
  • `Init`: all devices in the request have an action status of Pending
  • `Canceled`: the request was canceled by the requester while pending approval
  • `Completed`: all the devices in the request have an action status of Completed, Succeeded, Failed, or Canceled
  • `InProgress`: at least one device in the request has an action status of Processing
  • `Failed`: the request failed, the request was declined, or the request was auto declined
  • `Scheduled`: the request is scheduled to take place in the future and all requests have an action status of Pending or Ready
    Applies to Send Message requests only
  • `PendingApproval`: the request is waiting to be approved
    Applies to dual approval requests only

createdDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) that the request was created

updatedDateTimeUtc.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) that the request was last updated

requester.description: The username of the entity that created the request

wipeType.description:
The type of File Delete action
  • `wipeSpecificUserFiles`: Deletes the files specified in `filePatterns`
  • `wipeAllUserFiles`: Deletes all user files (limited to 100 devices per request)
  • `wipeAllUserFilesAndOs`: Deletes all files including the operating system (limited to 100 Windows devices per request)

secureEraseCount.description:
The number of times the file content is overwritten with non-sensitive data (series of zeros and ones)
Options are `1`, `3`, or `7`.

includeFileDateInLog.description:
When `wipeType` is `wipeSpecificUserFiles`, indicates whether the generated log file includes each file's creation date and time, and the date and time it was last modified or accessed
  • `true`: File dates are included
  • `false`: File dates are not included

filePatterns.description: When `wipeType` is `wipeSpecificUserFiles`, an array of objects, each object represents a file pattern

unenrollDevicesAndFreeLicenses.description:
When `wipeType` is not `wipeSpecificUserFiles`, indicates whether a Windows device should be unenrolled after the File Delete is complete
  • `true`: the device is unenrolled
    This option requires Perform permissions for Unenroll Device.
  • `false`: the device is not unenrolled

Mac devices are always unenrolled after the File Delete is complete.

deviceFreezeType.description:
The type of Freeze
  • `OnDemand`: Freezes the device on the next connection with the Absolute Monitoring Center, typically within 15 minutes
    Applies to all operating systems
  • `Scheduled`: Freezes a device on its next connection with the Absolute Monitoring Center on or after a specified date and time
    Applies to Windows and Mac devices that are regularly contacting the Absolute Monitoring Center
    Set the scheduled freeze date in `freezeDefinition.scheduledFreezeDateTimeUtc`

  • `OffLine`: Conditional - Offline Freeze

    Conditional - Offline Freeze has been replaced by Offline Freeze rules. Use the Secure Endpoint Console to set up an Offline Freeze rule.

offlineTimeSeconds.description:
The length of time (in seconds) that a device can be offline before it is frozen

Conditional - Offline Freeze has been replaced by Offline Freeze rules. Use the Secure Endpoint Console to set up an Offline Freeze rule.

scheduledFreezeDateTimeUtc.description:
The date and time (ISO 8601) the device should be frozen
Use when `freezeDefinition.deviceFreezeType` is `Scheduled`

DfzDefinition.description: An object that defines the Freeze request

nextPage.description: The pagination token that can be used to get the next page of results

ResponsePagination.description:
An object containing the pagination data
For more information, see Pagination

  • `true`: the device is unenrolled

  • `false`: the device is not unenrolled

Mac devices are always unenrolled after the File Delete is complete.

deviceGroupUid.description:
The system-defined unique identifier of the device group
The `deviceGroupUid` parameter is the same as the strings returned by the `deviceGroupIds` parameter in the Device Reporting resource

groupType.description:
The type of device group
  • `Smart`: smart device group
  • `Fixed`: static device group

displayName.description: The display name for the device group

description.description: The description for the device group

maxRunTime.description:
The Maximum Run Time or maximum length of time a script is allowed to run on a device
If `maxRunTimeUnit` is `minute`:
  • minimum: `1`
  • maximum: `1440`

If `maxRunTimeUnit` is `hour`:
  • minimum: `1`
  • maximum: `24`

maxRunTimeUnit.description:
The unit of time used for `maxRunTime`
  • `minute`
  • `hour`

displayMode.description:
The Display Mode or visibility of the Windows PowerShell dialog or the bash script when the script runs on a device
  • `Hidden`: the script runs in the background and is not visible to the user
  • `Maximized`: the Windows PowerShell dialog shows on the device
  • `Minimized`: the Windows PowerShell dialog is minimized in the Windows taskbar
Always `Hidden` on Mac devices

runPrivileges.description:
The Rights used to run the script
  • `Administrator`: the script runs using the rights associated with the local system account
  • `LoggedInUser`: the script runs using the rights of the logged in user

runWhen.description:
The Run condition which indicates whether the user is logged in when the script runs
  • `UserIsOrIsNotSignedIn`: the script runs regardless of whether a user is logged in
  • `UserIsSignedIn`: the script only runs when a user is logged in
  • `NoUserIsSignedIn`: the script only runs when no user is logged in
Always `UserIsOrIsNotSignedIn` on Mac devices

commandLine.description:
The PowerShell Parameters or Bash Parameters command line parameters used to execute the script, including the script's required and optional parameters
  • Contains parameter names and values
  • Syntax for Param1 and Param2:
    • -Param1 \"value1\"
    • -Param2 \"value2\"
Windows example: -Date \"January 31, 2021\" -Address \"ABC Company\"
Mac example: -d \"January 31, 2021\" -a \"ABC Company\"

alwaysRun32bits.description:
Indicates whether to Run 32-bit version of PowerShell on 64-bit Windows devices
  • `true`: the script runs using the 32-bit version of PowerShell (x86) on 64-bit Windows devices
  • `false`: the script runs using the 64-bit version of PowerShell on 64-bit Windows devices
Always `false` on Mac devices

startupDir.description: The location used by the agent to download and run scripts on the device

RunScriptOption.description: The Advanced Configuration Options used to execute the script on devices

deviceUids.description: The system-defined unique identifiers of the devices included in the request. Passing an empty list will return results for all applicable devices

items.description: The system-defined unique identifiers of the devices included in the request. Passing an empty list will return results for all applicable devices

name.description: The name of the policy group

description.description: The description of the policy group

policyGroupUid.description: The system-defined unique identifier of the policy group

deviceCount.description: The number of devices in the policy group

onObsoleteVersion.description:
Indicates whether the policy group's assigned agent version is unsupported
  • `true`: the agent version is no longer supported
  • `false`: the agent version is supported

supportPaas.description:
Indicates whether the policy group supports Persistence-as-a-Service (PaaS)
  • `true`: PaaS is supported
  • `false`: PaaS is not supported

isSystem.description:
Indicates whether the policy group is system-defined
  • `true`: the policy group is system-defined. Only the Global Policy Group has this value.
  • `false`: the policy group is user-defined

osVersionRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the version of the operating system that is running

totalRiskScore.description: Calculated value (as a percentage) that represents the risk posed by the state of the hardware and software detected on an Android device

deviceRooted.description: If `true`, the device is rooted and the user of the device can access the operating system and make software code changes

deviceRootedRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether the device is rooted

romType.description: Indicates whether a custom ROM is detected on the device

romTypeRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether a custom ROM is detected on the device

bootloaderUnlock.description: If `true`, the user is able to unlock the device's bootloader

bootloaderUnlockRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether the user is able to unlock the device's bootloader

lockScreenProtection.description: If `true`, the device requires authentication to be unlocked

lockScreenProtectionRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether the device requires authentication to be unlocked

screenTimeoutSecs.description: The length of time (in seconds) that can elapse before the idle device is locked

screenTimeoutSecsRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the screen timeout lock

deviceEncryptedRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether the device is encrypted

sdCardEncrypted.description: If `true`, the SD card is encrypted

sdCardEncryptedRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether the SD card is encrypted

adbEnabled.description: If `true`, the USB debugging setting is enabled on the device

adbEnabledRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether USB debugging setting is enabled

unknownSourcesInstall.description: If `true`, the Unknown sources setting is enabled on the device

unknownSourcesInstallRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether the Unknown sources setting is enabled

googleAppVerificationLevel.description: Indicates whether the Verify apps via USB setting is enabled on the device

googleAppVerificationLevelRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the Google App Verification Level

googleAppVerificationFrequency.description:
Indicates whether the Scan device for security threats is enabled in Verify Apps
  • `INSTALL_UPDATE_ONLY`: app verification occurs when an app is installed or updated
  • `Install_Update_Scan`: app verification occurs when an app is installed or updates, and periodically

googleAppVerificationFrequencyRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the Google App Verification Frequency

nonGoogleAppVerification.description: If `true`, a third party (non-Google) anti-malware application is detected on the device

nonGoogleAppVerificationRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether a third party anti-malware app is installed on the device

gmsCertified.description: If `true`, the device is a Google Mobile Service (GMS) certified device.

gmsCertifiedRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on whether the device is a GMS certified device

lastSecurityUpdateUTCRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the last security patch detected on the device

lastMacAddressChangeDays.description: The number of days since this last Mac Address change

lastMacAddressChangeDaysRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the number of days since this last Mac Address change

lastImeiChangeDays.description: The number of days since the last IMEI change

lastImeiChangeDaysRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the number of days since the last IMEI change

lastImsiChangeDays.description: The number of days since the last IMSI change

lastImsiChangeDaysRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the number of days since the last IMSI change

lastFactoryResetDays.description: The number of days since that last factory reset

lastFactoryResetDaysRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the number of days since that last factory reset

installedAvApps.description: A comma-delimited list of supported Android anti-virus applications installed on the device

installedAvAppsRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the anti-virus applications installed

installedCloudApps.description: A comma-delimited list of supported Android cloud file share applications installed on the device

installedCloudAppsRisk.description: The risk associated with the device based on the cloud file share applications installed

installedEmmApps.description: A comma-delimited list of the supported Android Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) applications installed on the device
