 # Release Notes

The release notes list the changes introduced into the API.

June 2025

New resources and endpoints

The following resource has been added:

  • Agents: Use the Agents resource to configure the setting for automatic agent updates, and set the default agent version when automatic agent updates are disabled. You can also query the policy groups assigned to a particular agent version.

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /reporting/devices-advanced and GET /reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrECLYPSIUM: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Eclypsium

May 2025

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /reporting/devices-advanced and GET /reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrOKTAVERIFY: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Okta Verify

The following parameters have been added to the GET /actions/freeze/requests/{requestUid} endpoint:

  • actionStatus: The action status of the request on the device
  • actionStatusDetails: The action status details of the request on the device

April 2025

New resources and endpoints

The following resource has been added:

  • Playbook: Use the Playbook resource to submit Run Playbook requests to remotely recover a Windows device when a fatal system error prevents it from booting into Windows. You can also run a playbook to repair or recover a device when the operating system is operational.

Improvements

You can now include up to 10,000 devices in the request body for the following endpoints:

  • POST /actions/request/reach
  • POST /actions/request/eum
  • POST /actions/request/unenroll
  • POST /actions/request/file-delete
  • POST /actions/request/wipe

March 2025

New resources and endpoints

The following resource has been added:

  • Device Group Tree: Use the Device Group Tree resource to create folders and static device groups.

New script sample

A script sample for the Bash coding language has been added to the Getting started: Create your request section.

February 2025

New resources and endpoints

The following endpoints have been added:

  • Get an End User Message: Get information about an End User Message by messageUid.
  • Get End User Messages: Get information about all End User Messages that exist in the Secure Endpoint Console.

January 2025

New resources and endpoints

The following resource has been added:

  • Policy Groups: Use the Policy Groups resource to create, manage, and query policy groups, and update the activation status of policies. You can also move devices from one policy group to another.

New parameters

  • The following query parameter has been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:
    • policyGroupUidEmpty: When set to `true`, filters results to include responses where policyGroupUid is empty or null. Use this query parameter to query devices in the Global Policy Group.
  • The following parameter has been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:
    • rnrLanScopeAnClient: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for LanScope An Client
  • The following parameter has been added to the request body schema for the POST /v3/actions/requests/freeze endpoint:
    • messageUid: The system-defined unique identifier of the Freeze message included in the request

    Use the messageUid parameter to specify an existing message. The message and messageName parameters are now optional.

  • The following parameter has been added to the request body schema for the POST /v3/actions/requests/eum endpoint:
    • messageUid: The system-defined unique identifier of the End User Message included in the request

    Use the messageUid parameter to specify an existing message. The message parameter is now optional. Learn more

Fixes

  • When using the POST /v3/tracking/device-missing/missing endpoint to report a device missing, the request is now processed successfully when the emailContacts parameter is empty.
  • When using the POST /v3/actions/requests/reach endpoint to create a Run script request, the Script name field is no longer empty when you view the request in the console.

November 2024

New parameters

The following parameter has been added to the object deviceFreezeActionStatus.statuses.status in the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • deviceFreezeActionStatus.statuses.status.score: The score of the individual freeze request

New resources and endpoints

The following endpoint has been added:

  • Get device details (Compliance): Get information about the compliance status of the devices in your account.

Deprecated parameters

  • The following parameter from the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints has been deprecated:

    • freezePolicyUid: The system-defined unique identifier of the Freeze policy

July 2024

New parameters

The following parameter has been added to the customFields object in the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • cdfFieldName: The name of the Device Field

June 2024

Updated parameters

The following parameter description has been changed for the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrMcAfeeDE: McAfee Drive Encryption has been renamed Trellix Drive Encryption. The description of the parameter has been updated to include the new application name.

April 2024

Deprecated parameters

  • The following parameters from the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints did not return values so they have been deprecated (and replaced by parameters with new names listed in the next section):

    • rnrESESTPAV: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for ESET Endpoint Antivirus
    • rnrDellSupportAssistBusiness: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Dell SupportAssist for Business PCs

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrESETEPAV (replacing rnrESESTPAV): An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for ESET Endpoint Antivirus
  • rnrDellSupportAssistBusinessPCs (replacing rnrDellSupportAssistBusiness): An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Dell SupportAssist for Business PCs
  • orgUnits: The distinguished name of the Active Directory organizational unit that the device is associated with
  • rnrSEPIOAGENT: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Sepio Agent

February 2024

New resources and endpoints

The following resource has been added:

  • RSVP: Use the RSVP resource to remotely manage the BIOS supervisor password on select Windows devices.

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rsvpStatus: An object containing information about the supervisor password status on the device

    • isStrongPasswordRequired: If true, a strong password is required when you set the supervisor password on the device
    • isSupported: If true, the device supports remotely managing the supervisor password
    • status: The current status of the supervisor password on the device
    • version: The version of supervisor password that is on the device

January 2024

New parameters

The following parameter has been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrIvantiSAC: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Ivanti Secure Access Client

December 2023

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrTAEGIS: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Secureworks Taegis Agent
  • rnrTRUSTDELETE: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for OneBe TRUST DELETE

November 2023

New parameters

The following parameter has been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrCarbonBlackEDR: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for VMware Carbon Black EDR Sensor
  • rnrHALCYONAR: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Halcyon Anti Ransomware

October 2023

Deprecated parameters

  • The following parameters from the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints did not return values so they have been deprecated:

    • activeDirectoryData: An object containing information about the device's Active Directory data
    • bssId: The Basic Service Set Identifiers (BSSID) of the current wireless access point
    • networkSSID: The Service Set Identifier (SSID) of the connected Wi-Fi adapter

  • The following parameter from the request body schema of the PUT /v3/configurations/customfields/devices/{deviceUid} endpoint has been deprecated:

    • cdfFieldKey: The system-defined unique identifier assigned to the Device Field for the specified device. This parameter was used as an alternative identifier in Classic Absolute when cdfUid was not defined.

    This change allows users to provide a value for a Device Field on a device when the Device Field hasn't been previously set. If the parameter is included in the payload, it is ignored.

September 2023

Improvements

The query parameters for the GET /v3/reporting/devices and GET /v3/reporting/applications endpoints are now grouped to improve searchability. Learn more

New parameters

The following parameter has been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrJumpCloudAgent: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for JumpCloud Agent

Updated parameters

The following parameter description has been changed for the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrANYCONNECT: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client has been renamed Cisco Secure Client. The description of the parameter has been updated to include the new application name.

August 2023

New script samples

Script samples for the following coding languages have been added to the Getting started: Create your request section:

  • C#
  • Node.js

Improvements

  • New! Two Getting started sections have been added to the documentation:

    • Getting started: Create your credentials
    • Getting started: Create your request

    The code samples have been removed from the Authentication section. They are now part of Getting started: Create your request.

  • The request samples displayed beside each endpoint are generic. They contain all possible parameters that could be used in a request body even though in some cases, not all of the parameters can be used in the same request. They may need you to format them so they're compatible with the coding language you're using. They also must be wrapped in a data tag before you can use them in your code. To prevent errors from copying and pasting the request samples directly to your code, the Copy function has been removed.

July 2023

New parameters

The following parameter has been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrSYXSENSE: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Syxsense Responder

Improvements

The following endpoints now allow you to use an empty list in the deviceUids parameter. Leaving the parameter empty will return results for all applicable devices.

  • POST /v3/actions/eum/get-actions/{requestUid}
  • POST /v3/actions/eum/get-actions
  • POST /v3/actions/unenroll/get-actions/{requestUid}
  • POST /v3/actions/unenroll/get-actions
  • POST /v3/actions/wipe/get-actions/{requestUid}
  • POST /v3/actions/wipe/get-actions
  • POST /v3/actions/filedelete/get-actions/{requestUid}
  • POST /v3/actions/filedelete/get-actions

June 2023

Fixes

Message content in Freeze requests and Send Message requests is now validated and any HTML tags or attributes that may expose Absolute servers or agents to injection attacks, such as cross site scripting (XSS), are automatically removed.

Deprecated parameters

The Secure Endpoint Agent for Android is no longer supported and all existing Android devices have been unenrolled from their respective accounts. As a result, the aspInfo object has been deprecated.

May 2023

Fixes

Updated PowerShell code sample:

  • The code sample now works with PowerShell version 7.
    If you are using PowerShell version 7 or higher, you need to use the updated code sample.
  • If you have never opened Internet Explorer and you are using a version of PowerShell lower than 6, you may get an error message using the old code sample. This is now fixed in the new code sample.
    If you are successfully using PowerShell with the older version, you can continue to use the previous code sample.
  • The code sample now supports using HTML tags.

March 2023

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrActivTrak: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for ActivTrak Agent
  • rnrAvast: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Avast Antivirus
  • rnrBUFFERZONE: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for BUFFERZONE Security
  • rnrDellSupportAssistBusiness: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Dell Support Assist for Business PCs
  • rnrHPTechPulse: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for HP TechPulse
  • rnrNetSfere: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for NetSfere
  • rnrOctopus: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Octopus Desk
  • rnrSymantecMA: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Symantec Management Agent

Fixes

  • In some cases, the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints didn't return the deviceFreezeStatus.passCode and deviceFreezeStatus.displayPasscode parameters for users with the Remove Freeze permission and did return the parameters for users without the Remove Freeze Permission. This issue is now fixed.
  • Following the release of 7.22, the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints did not always return the deviceFreezeActionStatus.score parameter. This issue is now fixed.

February 2023

New resources and endpoints

The following resources have been added:

  • Missing Devices: Use the Missing Devices resource to report devices missing or found, and query devices that have been reported missing.
  • Device Groups: Use the Device Groups resource to to query existing device groups.

January 2023

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrEClinicalWorks: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for eClinicalWorks Plug-in
  • rnrForescoutSC: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Forescout SecureConnector

November 2022

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrIMTLazarus: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for IMTLazarus Agent
  • rnrXMCyber: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for XM Cyber HaXM

October 2022

New resource and endpoints

The following resources have been added:

  • Wipe: Use the Wipe resource to submit Wipe requests, query existing requests by device or request, cancel requests, and download Certificates of Sanitization.
  • File Delete: Use the File Delete resource to submit File Delete requests, query existing requests by device or request, cancel requests, and download Certificates of Sanitization.
  • Messaging: Use the Messaging resource to submit Send Message requests, query existing requests by device or request, and cancel requests.
  • Custom Data: Use the Custom Data resource to query, add, enable, and disable Custom Data policy data point configurations, get a list of data points and their scan results for devices, and query errors that occurred during data point collection.

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrAranda: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Aranda Agent
  • rnrBigFix: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for HCL BigFix
  • rnrOPSWATClient: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for OPSWAT Client
  • rnrPixartMDM: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Pixart MDM
  • rnrUnowhyMDM: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Unowhy MDM

August 2022

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrDeepInstinct: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Deep Instinct
  • rnrDellTrustedDA: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Dell Trusted Device Agent
  • rnrNorton: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Norton 360

June 2022

New parameters

The following parameters have been added to the GET /v3/reporting/devices-advanced and GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoints:

  • rnrFireEye: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for FireEye Endpoint Agent
  • rnrIVANTI_NEURO: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Ivanti Neurons Agent
  • rnrMagicEndpoint: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for WinMagic MagicEndpoint
  • rnrMalwarebytes: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Malwarebytes Endpoint Agent
  • rnrPersystent: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Utopic Persystent
  • rnrRapid7: An object containing information about the Application Resilience policy for Rapid7 Insight Agent

post.summary:
Report devices missing

Report the devices devices specified in the `deviceUids` request body schema parameter missing.

Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`. You can include up to 100 devices in each request.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

get.summary:
Get device details (Compliance)

Get information about the compliance status of the devices in your account.

Use the query parameters to limit the devices and the information that is returned.

Get device details (Advanced)

Get information about devices in your account.

Use the query parameters to limit the devices and the information that is returned. The `filter` query parameter uses advanced Open Data Protocol (OData) style filtering. For more information, see Advanced filtering.

get.summary:
Get device details

Get information about devices in your account.

Use the query parameters to limit the devices and the information that is returned.
get.description:
Get device details

Get information about devices in your account.

Use the query parameters to limit the devices and the information that is returned.

parameters.description:
A comma-delimited list of sorting keys and the direction of sorting (ascending or descending)
For more information, see Sorting
The default sort order `deviceUid:asc,appId:asc`
The allowed sorting keys with sort order `accountUid:asc`, `accountUid:desc`, `appId:asc`, `appId:desc`, `appName:asc`, `appName:desc`, `appOriginalName:asc`, `appOriginalName:desc`, `appOriginalPublisher:asc`, `appOriginalPublisher:desc`, `appOriginalVersion:asc`, `appOriginalVersion:desc`, `appPublisher:asc`, `appPublisher:desc`, `appVersion:asc`, `appVersion:desc`, `deviceAppId:asc`, `deviceAppId:desc`, `deviceName:asc`, `deviceName:desc`, `deviceSerialNumber:asc`, `deviceSerialNumber:desc`, `deviceUid:asc`, `deviceUid:desc`, `esn:asc`, `esn:desc`, `firstDetectDateTimeUtc:asc`, `firstDetectDateTimeUtc:desc`, `installDateTimeUtc:asc`, `installDateTimeUtc:desc`, `installPath:asc`, `installPath:desc`, `lastScanDateTimeUtc:asc`, `lastScanDateTimeUtc:desc`, `major:asc`, `major:desc`, `minor:asc`, `minor:desc`, `osName:asc`, `osName:desc`, `userName:asc`, `userName:desc`
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description:
A comma-delimited list of fields to be returned in the results
You cannot use both the top level object and nested parameters at the same time
For more information, see Selecting
The allowed select fields `accountUid`, `appId`, `appName`, `appOriginalName`, `appOriginalPublisher`, `appOriginalVersion`, `appPublisher`, `appVersion`, `deviceAppId`, `deviceName`, `deviceSerialNumber`, `deviceUid`, `esn`, `firstDetectDateTimeUtc`, `installDateTimeUtc`, `installPath`, `lastScanDateTimeUtc`, `major`, `minor`, `osName`, `userName`
parameters.name: select

parameters.description:
The pagination token for the next page of results
For more information, see Pagination
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description:
The number of records to be returned per page
Default: `100`
Maximum: `10000`
For more information, see Pagination
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:

post.summary:
Move devices to a policy group

Move devices from one policy group to another.

Moving a device may change its activated policies, agent version, or Offline Freeze rule. For more information, see Important considerations in the Moving devices between policy groups topic in the console help.

Use the GET /v3/configurations/policy-groups endpoint to find a `policyGroupUid`.
Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`.

delete.summary:
Delete a policy group

Delete a user-defined policy group by `policyGroupUid`.

Deleting a policy group moves its devices to the Global Policy Group. This may may change each device's activated policies, agent version, or Offline Freeze rule. For more information, see Managing policy groups in the console help.

Use the GET /v3/configurations/policy-groups endpoint to find a `policyGroupUid`.
delete.description:
Delete a policy group

Delete a user-defined policy group by `policyGroupUid`.

Deleting a policy group moves its devices to the Global Policy Group. This may may change each device's activated policies, agent version, or Offline Freeze rule. For more information, see Managing policy groups in the console help.

Use the GET /v3/configurations/policy-groups endpoint to find a `policyGroupUid`.

get.summary:
Get all policy groups

Get information about all existing policy groups.
get.description:
Get all policy groups

Get information about all existing policy groups.

post.summary:
Create a policy group

Create a new policy group by specifying a name and description.

To create a duplicate of an existing policy group, specify its `policyGroupUid`. Use the GET /v3/configurations/policy-groups endpoint to find the existing policy group's `policyGroupUid`.

To add devices to the new policy group, use the POST /v3/configurations/policy-groups/move-devices endpoint.
post.description:
Create a policy group

Create a new policy group by specifying a name and description.

To create a duplicate of an existing policy group, specify its `policyGroupUid`. Use the GET /v3/configurations/policy-groups endpoint to find the existing policy group's `policyGroupUid`.

To add devices to the new policy group, use the POST /v3/configurations/policy-groups/move-devices endpoint.

patch.summary:
Configuring automatic agent updates

Control how the Secure Endpoint Agent is updated on the devices in your account.

By default, your account is set to automatically update the agent when a new agent version is available, but you can disable this setting. Prepare the request body as follows:

  • To disable automatic agent updates, set `mode` to `Manual`. All devices will remain on the current agent version, which is automatically set as the `defaultVersion`.
  • To enable automatic agent updates if they are disabled, set `mode` to `Automatic`.
  • To update the default agent version when automatic agent updates are disabled (mode is set to `Manual`), specify the new version in the `defaultVersion` parameter. Note that you can't specify a lower agent version than the current default version because agent downgrades are not supported.
For more information, see Managing automatic agent updates in the console help.
patch.description:
Configuring automatic agent updates

Control how the Secure Endpoint Agent is updated on the devices in your account.

By default, your account is set to automatically update the agent when a new agent version is available, but you can disable this setting. Prepare the request body as follows:

  • To disable automatic agent updates, set `mode` to `Manual`. All devices will remain on the current agent version, which is automatically set as the `defaultVersion`.
  • To enable automatic agent updates if they are disabled, set `mode` to `Automatic`.
  • To update the default agent version when automatic agent updates are disabled (mode is set to `Manual`), specify the new version in the `defaultVersion` parameter. Note that you can't specify a lower agent version than the current default version because agent downgrades are not supported.
For more information, see Managing automatic agent updates in the console help.

put.summary:
Update policy groups to a new agent version

When automatic agent updates are disabled, you can create a request to update the devices in select policy groups to the agent version specified in the `agentVersion` path parameter. You can include up to 1000 policy groups in a request.

If the agent version is unknown, you can use the GET /configurations/policy-groups endpoint to find an `agentVersion`. Also use the GET /configurations/policy-groups endpoint to find a `policyGroupUid`.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

  • `Pending`: The `actionStatus` for Unenroll device requests transition from `Pending` to `Processing` almost immediately
  • `Ineligible`: The device is ineligible for the action
  • `Failed`: Either the system or the device was unable to execute the action
  • `Canceled`: A user canceled the action
    In most cases, the `actionStatus` doesn't remain `Pending` long enough to cancel the action
  • `Processing`: The `actionStatus` for Unenroll device requests transition from `Processing` to `Completed` almost immediately
  • `Completed`: The Unenroll device request was submitted successfully and the device's `agentStatus` is set to `D` (disabled)

post.summary:
Unenroll devices

Create an Unenroll Device request for the devices specified in the `deviceUids` request body schema parameter.

Devices included in an Unenroll Device request are validated to ensure they are eligible to be unenrolled from Absolute. The Unenroll Device request is initiated on eligible devices. To be eligible, devices must meet the following criteria:

  • `agentStatus` is `a` (Active): Unenroll Device requests are not supported on disabled or inactive devices.
  • `isStolen` is `false`: Unenroll Device requests are not supported on devices that have been reported Stolen.

If there are outstanding security actions on a device, such as a Freeze or Wipe request, these actions are overridden by an Unenroll Device request.

Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`. You can include up to 10,000 devices in each request.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.
post.description:
Unenroll devices

Devices included in an Unenroll Device request are validated to ensure they are eligible to be unenrolled from Absolute. The Unenroll Device request is initiated on eligible devices. To be eligible, devices must meet the following criteria:

  • `agentStatus` is `a` (Active): Unenroll Device requests are not supported on disabled or inactive devices.
  • `isStolen` is `false`: Unenroll Device requests are not supported on devices that have been reported Stolen.

If there are outstanding security actions on a device, such as a Freeze or Wipe request, these actions are overridden by an Unenroll Device request.

Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`. You can include up to 10,000 devices in each request.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

post.summary:
Manage a supervisor password

Create a Manage Supervisor Password request to remotely create, update, or remove the supervisor password for the devices specified in the `deviceUids` request body schema parameter.

You can initiate one type of supervisor password action (create, update, or remove) for each Manage Supervisor Password request.
All devices in the request must have the same `rsvpStatus.status` and `rsvpStatus.version`. All 2.x versions are considered to be the same version.

To complete the Manage Supervisor Password request, the device user needs to restart the device.

For more information about Manage Supervisor Password requests, see Managing supervisor passwords in the console help.

Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find:

  • `rsvpStatus.version`
  • `rsvpStatus.status`
  • `rsvpStatus.isStrongPasswordRequired`
  • `deviceUid`

You can include up to 10,000 devices in each request.

post.summary:
Run a script

Create and execute a Run Script request on one or more devices using a script from the Reach Library. Set the Advanced Configuration Options used to execute the Reach script.

Scripts must be uploaded to the Reach Library in the Secure Endpoint Console prior to creating the Run Script request.

You can initiate a Run Script request on Windows and Mac devices. When you create a Run Script request, both the `winScriptOption` and `macScriptOption` request body schema parameters are optional.

  • If the request body contains only `winScriptOption`, the script only runs on Windows devices.
  • If the request body contains only `macScriptOption`, the script only runs on Mac devices.
  • If the request body contains both `winScriptOption` and `macScriptOption`, the script runs on both Windows and Mac devices.
  • If the request body contains neither `winScriptOption` nor `macScriptOption`, the script runs on both Windows and Mac devices using the default values.

Use the GET /v3/actions/reach/scripts endpoint to find the `scriptUid`.
Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`. You can include up to 10,000 devices in each request.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.
post.description:
Run a script

Scripts must be uploaded to the Reach Library in the Secure Endpoint Console prior to creating the Run Script request.

You can initiate a Run Script request on Windows and Mac devices. When you create a Run Script request, both the `winScriptOption` and `macScriptOption` request body schema parameters are optional.

  • If the request body contains only `macScriptOption`, the script only runs on Mac devices.
  • If the request body contains both `winScriptOption` and `macScriptOption`, the script runs on both Windows and Mac devices.
  • If the request body contains neither `winScriptOption` nor `macScriptOption`, the script runs on both Windows and Mac devices using the default values.

post.summary:
Run a playbook

Create a Run Playbook request for the devices specified in the `deviceUids` request body schema parameter.

Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`.You can include up to 1000 devices in each request.

Use the GET /v3/actions/playbook/templates endpoint to find the `playbookTemplateUid`, `playbookOptions`, and `isoVariables` of the playbook you want to run.

For more information about Run Playbook requests, see Running playbooks in the console help.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.
post.description:
Run a playbook

Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`.You can include up to 1000 devices in each request.

For more information about Run Playbook requests, see Running playbooks in the console help.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

post.summary:
Freeze devices

Create an On-demand or Scheduled Freeze request for the devices specified in the `deviceUids` request body schema parameter.

Firmware Freeze is not available using the Absolute API. Use the Secure Endpoint Console to create a Freeze request if you want to create an On-demand Freeze request with the Freeze at Firmware option enabled.

You can initiate one type of Freeze for each Freeze request. Each device can only have one outstanding Freeze request of each type. If you submit a Freeze request for a particular type and the device already has an existing request of the same type, the new request replaces the existing request.

To use an existing Freeze message, use the GET /v3/actions/freeze/messages endpoint to find the `messageUid` and enter it in the request body schema of the new Freeze request. Alternatively, to create a new message, enter content in the `message` and `messageName` parameters.
Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`. You can include up to 10,000 devices in each request.

Make sure to record the `requestUid` from the response if you want to query the status of the Freeze request.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

post.summary:
Send a message

Create a Send Message request for the devices specified in the `deviceUids` request body schema parameter.

Use the GET /reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`. You can include up to 10,000 in each request. Note that the request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

To create a message, use the `message` parameter. Your message content must be in HTML format, and hyperlinks are supported. To confirm that your message is formatted correctly, create your message in an HTML file and view it in a web browser first. The message can be up to 15,000 characters.

  • The message that you create cannot contain Custom Device Fields.
  • The system validates message content and automatically removes any HTML tags or attributes that may expose Absolute servers or agents to injection attacks, such as cross site scripting (XSS).

To use an existing End User Message, use the GET /actions/eum/messages endpoint to find its `messageUid`.

post.summary:
Cancel a Run Script request

Attempt to cancel all Run Script actions with an `actionStatus` of `Pending` on the devices specified in the `deviceUids` request body schema parameter and the Run Script request specified by the `requestUid` path parameters.

When you submit a request to cancel outstanding actions in a Run Script request, it is possible that a device has an action status of Pending when the cancel request is created, but the status changes before the cancel request is sent to the device. In this case, the cancel request fails for that device and a detailed reason is provided.

Use the GET /v3/actions/reach/get-actions endpoint to find the `actionsStatus`.
Use the GET /v3/actions/requests/reach endpoint to find the `requestUid`.
Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

get.summary:
Get playbook templates

Get information about available playbook templates. This endpoint returns each template's `playbookTemplateUid` and the playbook's associated parameters.
get.description:
Get playbook templates

Get information about available playbook templates. This endpoint returns each template's `playbookTemplateUid` and the playbook's associated parameters.

get.summary:
Get playbook variables

Get the list of variables that can be used in playbook parameters. You can use variables to specify device-specific information when running a playbook on multiple devices.
For more information about using variables in playbooks, see Running playbooks in the console help.

get.description:

Get information about the Freeze request specified in the `requestUid` path parameter.

Use the `requestUid` that was returned when you created a Freeze request using the POST /v3/actions/requests/freeze endpoint.

post.summary:
Remove Freeze requests

Create a Remove Freeze request for the devices specified in the `deviceUids` request body schema parameter, regardless of the Freeze status. This request will unfreeze any of the specified devices that are frozen, and can also be used to remove outstanding Scheduled Freeze requests.

Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

Update an existing Freeze message. A Freeze message is the full screen message that shows on the device to inform the user that their device is frozen and it can't be used.

Use the GET /v3/actions/freeze/messages endpoint to find a `messageUid`.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

post.summary:
Create a Freeze message

A Freeze message is the full screen message that shows on the device to inform the user that their device is frozen and it can't be used. Your message content must be in HTML format, and hyperlinks are supported. To confirm that your message is formatted correctly, create your message in an HTML file and view it in a web browser first.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

Filters results to include responses where `actionStatus` equals the given value
May only contain one value
  • `Failed`: either the system or the device was unable to execute the action
  • `Pending`: the action has not been downloaded to the device
  • `Canceled`: the action has been canceled for the device
  • `Processing`: the action is currently being performed on the device but has not been completed yet
  • `Completed`: the action ran on the device

Get File Delete actions by request

Each File Delete request is made up of the actions that are sent to the individual devices. Get the status of these actions for the request specified by the `requestUid` path parameter and the devices specified by the `devicesUids` request body schema parameter.

Use the query parameters to filter the results by action status and creation date.

Use the GET /v3/actions/requests/file-delete endpoint to find the `requestUid`.
Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

get.summary:
Download a Certificate of Sanitization

Download a Certificate of Sanitization for the device specified by the `deviceUid` path parameter and certificate specified by the `certificateUid` path parameter.

Use the GET /v3/reporting/devices endpoint to find a `deviceUid`.
Use the POST /v3/actions/file-delete/get-actions endpoint to find the `certificateUid`.

A Certificate of Sanitization is only generated for File Delete requests where `wipeType` is `wipeAllUserFiles` or `wipeAllUserFilesandOs`.

parameters.name: requestUid

post.summary:
Cancel a Send Message request

Attempt to cancel all Send Message actions with an `actionsStatus` of `Pending`, `Ready`, or `Processing` for the request specified by the `requestUid` path parameter. Limit which actions in the request are canceled using the `actionUids` request body schema parameter.

When an action with a status of `Processing` is canceled, the message no longer appears on the device.

Use the GET /v3/actions/requests/eum endpoint to get the `requestUid`.
Use the GET /v3/actions/eum/get-actions endpoint to find the `actionStatus` and `action Uid`.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.

When an action with a status of `Processing` is canceled, the message no longer appears on the device.

Use the GET /v3/actions/requests/eum endpoint to get the `requestUid`.
Use the GET /v3/actions/eum/get-actions endpoint to find the `actionStatus` and `action Uid`.

The request body needs to be wrapped in a `data` tag.
